column4: evening all, what stuff do I need to apt-get to set up C development stuff
I know gcc is in apt, but stuff like libstd++ etc etc, should be packaged up somewhere
gcc is there in ur installation i guess
go to terminal and check if there is gcc
most installations have gcc , type gcc at terminal and see
thats news for me ;d i thought they were . check dude it really is , gcc is life to many
do one thing...click on applications , add package
and i got it without any customising during installation
sudo aptitude install build-essential   -   from the ubutu support pages
please stop trying to help me
